projectPurpose: To provide a powerful, efficient, and customizable flashcard program that utilizes spaced repetition to help users memorize information effectively for the long term.
mainFeatures: Spaced Repetition System (SM-2 and FSRS algorithms)
Content-agnostic flashcards (text, images, sound, video, LaTeX)
Support for various card types (cloze deletions, image occlusions)
Customizable flashcard layouts and review timing

alternatives.name: Mnemosyne
mainFeatures: Spaced repetition algorithm (based on early SuperMemo)

marketPositioning: Anki is positioned as a powerful, highly customizable, open-source spaced repetition flashcard program. It is favored by serious learners, particularly in demanding fields, due to its robust algorithm, content flexibility, extensive add-on ecosystem, and ability to handle large data sets. While its interface is often considered less modern than some competitors, its power and customization options, coupled with cross-platform syncing and a strong community, distinguish it from more consumer-oriented or language-specific alternatives. It is primarily a dedicated memorization tool, unlike some alternatives that integrate flashcards into broader knowledge management systems.
